review: Doctor didn't prescribe any ointment to apply on knee area. He asked the patient to do daily activities in pain. Now the pain aggravated..
reply_text: Thanks for your feedback . Unfortunately you have ligament / Meniscal injury in the knee which don’t respond to topical ointments . The doctor had advised that this condition needs surgical treatment but the patient preferred conservative management. Was advised that if the symptoms worsen - needs surgical treatment .

tags: Wait time,
review:
Worst
Dont cooperate with patient
And he didn't explain the problem
And solution to the treatement.
reply_text:
Don't cooperate with patient: Patient attender (Mother) requested a false certificate stating that they had taken treatment as an inpatient to claim insurance for a procedure which was done as an outpatient- Reason for not cooperating with patient.
Visited for Arthroscopy: Patient was a 12 year old with a broken bone in the forearm which required only plaster treatment- no indication or discussion about surgery .
Didn't explain the problem: Patient along with attender was seen twice and on the first visit a plaster slab was  applied with clear explanation of the nature of injury and plan of management. The patient was reviewed a week later with X-ray and clearly informed that the  plaster needs to stay for 4 weeks .
